questions.question: It's time you ........................... that stereo repaired.
questions.description: A simple past is used after it's time to refer to the present.

questions.question: She acts .......................... she knows his secrets.
questions.description: Either could be used to say what a situation seems like.

questions.question: It is time she ............................. a job.
questions.description: A simple past is used after it's time to refer to the present.

questions.question: I wish I ............................. longer hair.
questions.description: A simple past is used after I wish to express regret about the present.

questions.question: It seems ..................................... the cat was injured in the fall.
It is high time she .............................. smoking.
questions.description: A simple past is used after it is high time to refer to the present.

questions.question: It would have been better if you ............................... a doctor.
questions.description: In the third conditional, we use a past perfect tense in the if-clause and would have + past participle in the main clause.

questions.question: It would be better if you .................................. the police.
questions.description: In type  2 conditional, we use a simple past in the if-clause and would + first form of the verb in the main clause.

questions.question: I prefer classical music ............................... heavy metal.
I .............................. wait than leave.
questions.description: Prefer is followed by a to-infinitive or gerund. Would rather is followed by an infinitive without to.

questions.question: I prefer calling my friends ................................. writing to them.
questions.description: Prefer + ing form/to-infinitive + object + rather than + infinitive/ing form.

questions.question: I ................................. riding to driving.
questions.description: Prefer can be followed by an ing form or  to-infinitive.
